title: Religion Profile Template
description: Defines a religion including its gods, founding story, symbols, relics, holy sites, worship practices, afterlife beliefs, and clergy structure. Start with history because the founding story generates most other elements.

name.description: Religion name (and its meaning, e.g. Islam means submission, Buddhism from Buddha means enlightened one)

nicknames.description: Alternate names or informal references (e.g. 'the burning faith' for a fire god's religion)

god_attributes_emphasized.description: Which attributes of the god(s) are emphasized in worship

founding_story.description: How this religion was founded (the prophetic event)

death.description: How the prophet died -- martyrdom creates enemies, artifacts, and sites

symbols.description: Religious symbols derived from the god's attributes or founding events

colors.description: Religious colors (mood and state of mind associations)

relics.description: Holy relics from the founding story or significant events

afterlife_belief.description: What followers believe about the afterlife

sects_overview.description: Overview of sects that disagree about interpretations of texts -- each sect opposes others and wants them eradicated or drawn into the fold

relationship.description: How this species relates to the religion -- drawn to it, repulsed, targeted for conversion, excluded

species_relationships.description: How each species relates to this religion -- one may be drawn to it while another is repulsed

place_in_society.description: General role in society -- prominent at events, providing hostels, performing marriages, blessing games, administering burials

customs.description: Religious customs based on the deity -- greetings, shows of strength, blessings, specific touches or words

official_language.description: Official religious language -- typically the prophet's species language, possibly an ancient language no longer spoken

legal_influence.description: How this religion influences law (if at all)

famous_for.description: What this religion is most famous for

world_view.description: The religion's worldview and guiding philosophy

relations_with_military.description: How this religion relates to military forces

followers.description: General characterization of followers -- who they are, social class, species makeup

important_members.description: Important current members of this religion

combat.description: The religion's stance on combat, warfare, and violence

x-cross-references.god-profile: Gods worshiped are defined in God Profiles
x-cross-references.afterlife-design: Afterlife details are in the Afterlife Design Sheet
x-cross-references.clergy-profile: Clergy details are in the Clergy Profile
x-cross-references.religion-history: Historical events are in the Religion History Sheet
x-cross-references.religion-beliefs-practices: Detailed beliefs in the Religion Beliefs and Practices Template
x-cross-references.religion-membership: Membership details in the Religion Membership Sheet
